question: Whose tomb among the following is not located in India?
explanation:
• Akbar\'s tomb is an important Mughal architectural masterpiece. It was built in 1605–1613 and is situated in 119 acres of grounds in Sikandra, Agra.
• Humayun\'s tomb is the tomb of the Mughal Emperor Humayun in Delhi. The tomb was commissioned by Humayun\'s first wife Empress Bega Begum, in 1569-70.
• The Tomb of Jahangir is a 17th-century mausoleum built for the Mughal Emperor Jahangir. The mausoleum dates from 1637 and is located in Shahdara Bagh in Lahore along the banks of the Ravi River.
• Tomb of I\'timad-ud-Daulah is a Mughal mausoleum in the city of Agra in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh. Often described as a \"jewel box\", sometimes called the \"Bachcha Taj\", the tomb is often regarded as a draft of the Taj Mahal.
